content:
Diagnosis:
Fibrolamellar hepatocellular carcinoma with pulmonary metastases
Initial diagnosis March 2023
CK7 and CD68 positive on immunohistochemistry

Previous treatment:
Right hepatectomy April 2023
Commenced Atezolizumab/Bevacizumab May 2023

Current medications:
Atezolizumab 1200mg IV every 3 weeks
Bevacizumab 15mg/kg IV every 3 weeks

Current situation:
Pre-cycle 12 immunotherapy

CT chest/abdomen 15 April 2024 - stable appearances of pulmonary metastases, no new lesions

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 12 of immunotherapy. Treatment continues to be well tolerated with only grade 1 fatigue. Performance status remains 0. Latest liver function tests are stable and within normal range. No new symptoms reported. The recent CT scan shows continued disease stability with no new concerning features. The plan is to continue with the current treatment regimen and arrange repeat imaging in 3 months. Will review again before cycle 13 in 3 weeks.

cancer_timeline.value: CT chest/abdomen shows stable appearances of pulmonary metastases, no new lesions

patient_facts.value: Liver function tests stable and within normal range

status_updates.value: Fibrolamellar HCC with stable pulmonary metastases on immunotherapy maintenance. Well tolerated treatment with continued disease control.
Continuing Atezolizumab 1200mg and Bevacizumab 15mg/kg every 3 weeks
